intro: Pogonospermum lolioides var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf pogonospermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
